channel.title: No axoloti app on linux
channel.description: When running the following installation command to install debian package, using dpkg, e.g. sudo dpkg -i axoloti_linux_1.012.deb I get the error cannot access file or archive. Is it on another repository ? Or no longer supported ? Thanks

item.title: No axoloti app on linux
item.dc:creator: @andrewdovn Andrew Dovn
item.description:
@andrewdovn wrote:

Thanks. I cut and paste from the installation script and the underlines don't match the filename (i.e hyphens), so it couldn't find it, I wasn't thinking too carefully.. . Trying to follow the tested ubuntu 14.04 version, but I need an amd64 linux version , so I'll install that and have another go. Thanks again.

Read full topic

item.title: No axoloti app on linux

item.description:
@janvantomme wrote:

Don't think you'll need to build it from source. Just download the .deb and .tgz files and follow the instructions.

@andrewdovn wrote:

Thanks. I'll try building from github.

item.title: No axoloti app on linux
item.dc:creator: @janvantomme Jan Vantomme
item.description:
@janvantomme wrote:

Not sure if the Axoloti install is available on any package manager on Linux.

The official release can be found on Github, use the 1.0.12 version:

github.com

Releases · axoloti/axoloti

Sketching embedded digital audio. Contribute to axoloti/axoloti development by creating an account on GitHub.

Install guide for Linux:

Installing on Linux User Guide
Normal Installation To reduce size we split the application into two parts, the main axoloti application, and a runtime which contains other required files. You must download and install both initially. (Usually updates will only require the main application to be downloaded and installed.) download both application bundle and axoloti_runtime go to http://github.com/axoloti/axoloti/releases , you will see the 'latest release' download axo_runtime_linux_(version).tgz download axoloti_linux_…

Read full topic
